basics.name: C.E. Dallas Hoffman
basics.title: Geospatial Information Analytics Science and Technology Professional (GISP)
basics.summary: Mission-oriented, keenly dynamic GIS and data analytics professional who thrives on challenges demanding adaptability and fortitude. Over two decades work experience in myriad roles, realms, industries, and geographical locations. Passionate autodidact,* lifelong learner - dedicated to maintaining mastery in geospatial information sciences, including environmental analysis, imagery and photogrammetry, cartography, data management, web services, and LiDAR point cloud processing techniques, in addition to programming and development of blended data analysis solutions using free, open source software (FOSS).

skills.name: GIS Platforms
keywords: ESRI Suite: ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Pro, ArcMap, ArcServer, etc.

skills.name: Coding/Programming/Scripting
keywords: Python, R, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, REST, SQL, GitHub, JupyterLab/Notebook, Visual Studio Code, XML

skills.name: Data Management
keywords: MS Access, PostgreSQL, pgAdmin, MS Server, ArcGIS Server Manager, ArcSDE

skills.name: Other
keywords: Microsoft Office/365: Excel, OneNote, OneDrive, Outlook, PowerPoint, Sway, Teams, Word

professional experience.name: North Carolina State University
professional experience.dept: Department of Civil, Construction, and Environmental Engineering -- Coastal Engineering Research Lab
professional experience.position: Geospatial Data Scientist, Vice Project Manager
highlights: Responsible for the production of dozens of geostatistical intel datasets, graphs, charts, and map layouts to support critical coastal hazard, erosion mitigation, and shoreline engineering operations for the NC Department of Transportation’s Coastal Monitoring Program (CMP) and annual reports.

professional experience.name: North Carolina State University
professional experience.dept: Department of Biological and Agricultural Engineering -- Data Science Extension
professional experience.summary: Approached by the N.C. State Climate Office to develop an open source, cloud-based data analysis tutorial component for a U.S. Soy/United Soybean Board funded research project.
highlights: Authored and deployed both a statistical and geospatial data analytics interactive, cloud-based, live-coding environment package utilizing a unique poly-glot 'script of scripts', multi-language kernels notebook framework and code+content+configuration repository docker image in JupyterLab and Binder.

professional experience.name: Zonda (formerly Hanley Wood Meyers Research, MetroStudy Inc.)
professional experience.summary: Served as the sole GIS and Geospatial subject matter expert on an 11+ member research team within the Data Intelligence department covering all 50 states.
highlights: This was my part-time job the entire time I was in graduate school.

professional experience.name: Theorem Geo Associates
professional experience.position: Geospatial Consultant and GIS Data Analyst
professional experience.summary: Projects for Duke Energy: Land Strategy and Real Estate, Environmental Health and Safety, and Transmission Vegetation Management.
highlights: Began at Theorem Geo as an entry-level (and only just recently self-taught) GIS Technician. Hired for the specific role of what essentially was project manager, and quickly ascertained the overall scope, goals, and needs of this particular assignment, which actually necessitated its official development. After six months, was promoted to Geospatial Consultant and assigned to consult as a GIS Data Analyst on various other projects. Left the company after being accepted into the MGIST graduate program at NC State University, thus moving up to the beautiful City of Oaks!

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
